meanings.sent1: She excelled in math class, always getting the highest grades.
meanings.sent2: The athlete excelled in the race, finishing first by a large margin.
meanings.sent3: Despite his small size, the tiny ant excelled in carrying food many times its weight.
meanings.sent4: The student excelled in the exam, soaring above the rest like an eagle in the sky.
meanings.sent5: Her talent for painting truly excelled, capturing the beauty of nature effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To surpass in achievement or quality
meanings.sent1: The new restaurant excelled in serving delicious food that kept customers coming back.
meanings.sent2: The company excelled in customer service, always going above and beyond for their clients.
meanings.sent3: The cat excelled in napping, finding the most comfortable spots in the house.
meanings.sent4: His speech excelled in inspiring the audience, igniting a fire of motivation in their hearts.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower excelled in reaching great heights, standing tall and proud in the garden.
